Build 20020402
Linux-Motif

I opened a JavaEditor on a file and noticed that it had some code highlighted as
a temporary problem. Now, I hadn't edited the file yet and I know there were no
problems in it (I'd just extracted source from the PDE binary shipped in
20020402). Anyway, I was curious to see what the problem was going to say, so I
hit ctrl+e to select it. The following WID error occurred.

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed

the walkback occurs during activation and isn't JDT related.
Moving one layer down to Platform UI

Unable to reproduce on Linux or Windows with the latest UI code.
One thing I don't understand: You indicate that the code had a temporary 
problem, do you mean a red sqiggly but no red x in the margin?
In this case ctrl-e does not do anything.

Several fixes have been made in this area.
Unable to reproduce in 20020515.
Closing, reopen if still a problem.
